snippet: United States Border Patrol agents will no longer serve as interpreters when local law enforcement agencies request language help, according to a new decree.
abstract: Homeland Security Dept issues decree that United States Border Patrol agents will no longer serve as interpreters when local law enforcement agencies request language help.
lead_paragraph: United States Border Patrol agents will no longer serve as interpreters when local law enforcement agencies request language help, according to a new decree.

headline.main: Washington: Border Guards Will Cease Acting as Interpreters
headline.print_headline: Washington: Border Guards Will Cease Acting as Interpreters
